reviews.review_msg: Like someone else said, Christian is the definition of "chaotic good." He is so engaging to have in class and is very personable and funny. He is always open to questions and discussions. I actually looked forward to his class every week! In order to do well in classes, read notes before class. His lectures are additional info. and application.

Although he is an amazing and funny person, his class was very difficult to follow. Extremely disorganized, NEVER replies to emails and does not have any guidelines for assignments/tests. He never told us about assignment due dates or when tests were going to be. He spent the first month teaching us about things that didn't even end up on the MT

This guy is the definition of chaotic good. He lets students debate the grading at the beginning of semester, he always takes longer than he thinks he will for Modules, Powerpoints, etc. He only speaks in French! Very kind and caring, good sense of humour, easily accessible, clear instructions. He goes on tangents, is distractible but great vibes

Christian is my favorite prof at SFU. He explains all concepts in great detail, if you listen carefully in class and participate, you should do fine on the tests. He is very passionate about linguistics and made me love it too. Make sure you take notes and practice if you wish to perform above and beyond. Don't miss out on getting to know him!

Very enthusiastic and likeable as a person but he is a completely disorganized prof who only uses the incomplete website from his previous course that no longer exists. Hands out worksheets on certain topics never mentioned in class. Lacks clarity in his delivery in lectures, and tests do not reflect the knowledge learned in class.

Rejean got upset when we used our computers during lectures despite not posting the slides in advance. This led to us being unable to take notes on what he was saying and left us totally confused come the time of the exams and assignments. I would avoid him at all costs as a professor. He was also not approachable for questions.

He puts paragraphs on his lecture slides and rushes through them giving us not enough time to write proper notes, and he refuses to give access to his powerpoint slides. He's rude and sassy, and showed up late to class every day. Horrible at explaining topics as well. Be prepared to rip ur hair out for how boring his lectures can be.

Hybrid Course: Prof. Canac-Marquis was passionate for the subject matter and compassionate as he was constantly making concessions for students who did not follow online. He did everything he could to not leave anyone behind and make sure they got the most out of the class even though there were several students who only showed up on exam days.

Extremely unorganized the entire semester and was rarely able to coherently answer any of the questions during class or in office hours (Don't bother going). He makes no sense during lectures and was very rude and condescending and the least accommodating professor I've ever encountered, avoid this teacher if you care about your grades.

He only speaks English during office hours and is not helpful. He does not prepare you for tests or the 3 group projects (worth most of the grade). He posts A LOT on canvas and the course is heavily based on that material. You basically have to teach yourself. The second + third part of the class is super hard so make sure to understand properly.

Prof Marquis is super clear and organized, all his lecture are Power Points and posted on CANVAS. Lots of group projects and break out room discussions and his expectations for evaluations are very clear. He is super friendly and funny too! Sometimes lectures are long without breaks. This required course is not easy, but i did okay.

Very boring lectures. He doesn't bother helping at all; even during his office hours, he rudely disregards questions. He often forgets to post stuff online and then expects you to magically know everything. AVOID

RÃ©jean is hilariously bad with technology, and as its a zoom class he is quite funny. His lectures go over every class, but its because students are wasting so much time asking ridiculous questions. He gives extremely clear testing criteria, breaks up lectures with group work, and will stay after class to answer questions.

Be prepared to sleep the first month during lectures. No final, instead 3 group projects worth 50% that were not well explained. Not a consistant marker, and pretty disorganized. Test content is outlined and straightforward. if you visit him during office hours and finesse, he'll probably bump you up. Overall, easy class to get a B.

Although you're likely to get an okay grade in his class because he is an easy marker, his lack organization will drive you nuts. We did not have a textbook in this class and many of us were left to google the questions we had if they were not answered in his notes on Canvas.
Hottest prof in the department by a mile (which still isn't saying much.) Super disorganized
